body.p:
Born on April 18, 1810 in Giles County, Tennessee. Taught school in Giles County. Entered Manual Labor Academy (later Jackson College) in 1831. Began to study law at Pulaski. Admitted to the bar in 1834. Enlisted in First Tennessee Mounted Volunteers in the Seminole Wars in 1836. Married Mary Ann Trimble in 1839 and they had eight children.
Represented Giles County in the Tennessee General Assembly from 1837 to 1839. Won 1847 gubernatorial election, Brown lost his bid for reelection in 1849 to William S. Trousdale. Appointed Minister to Russia by President Zachary Taylor in 1850, served until 1853. Represented Davidson County from 1855-1857. Governor Isham G. Harris appointed him as a member of the Military and Financial Board in 1861. Died on January 30, 1886, and was buried in Mt. Olivet Cemetery in Nashville.
